pullRequest.body:
This PR does the following
- Renames `Sheaf.IsDiscrete`Â to `Sheaf.IsConstant` and changes the definition to being in the essential image of the constant sheaf functor instead of requiring the counit to be an isomorphism. 
- Removes two lemmas from the file `Sites.Discrete` which were essentially duplicates of other ones, and simplifies a proof to be able to remove an auxiliary lemma. 
- Moves the remaining contets of `Sites.Discrete` to the file `Sites.ConstantSheaf`.

---

I added these lemmas initially because I used them in #14027, but it turns out they're essentially duplicates of other lemmas, now merged into one lemma `constantSheafAdj_counit_w` which is used in this file and in #14027.


---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

| Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.ConstantSheaf | 672 | 890 | +218 (+32.44%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.Discrete`|-891|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.SheafCohomology.Basic`|126|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.ConstantSheaf`|218|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsConstant`
`+ Sheaf.isConstant_iff_forget`
`+ Sheaf.isConstant_iff_of_equivalence`
`+ Sheaf.isConstant_of_forget`
`+ constantCommuteCompose_hom_app_val`
`+ constantSheafAdj_counit_w`
`+ instance [(constantSheaf J D).Faithful] [(constantSheaf J D).Full] (F : Sheaf J D)`
`+ instance [h : F.IsConstant J] : ((sheafCompose J U).obj F).IsConstant J := by`
`+ isConstant_congr`
`+ isConstant_iff_isIso_counit_app`
`+ isConstant_iff_isIso_counit_app'`
`+ isConstant_iff_mem_essImage`
`+ isConstant_of_isIso_counit_app`
`+ isConstant_of_iso`
`+ mem_essImage_of_isConstant`
`- IsDiscrete`
`- constantCommuteComposeApp_comp_counit`
`- constantSheafAdj_counit_app`
`- instance [h : F.IsDiscrete J ht] : ((sheafCompose J U).obj F).IsDiscrete J ht := by`
`- isDiscrete_iff_forget`
`- isDiscrete_iff_isIso_counit_app`
`- isDiscrete_iff_mem_essImage`
`- isDiscrete_iff_mem_essImage'`
`- isDiscrete_iff_of_equivalence`
`- isDiscrete_of_iso`
`- sheafComposeNatIso_app_counit`
`- sheafCompose_reflects_discrete`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10700940375/job/29665780292)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10700940375/job/29665780021)

It would be better to ask that `F` belongs to the essential image of the functor `constantSheaf` (note also that it would not depend on the existence/a choice of a terminal object.). (If `C` corresponds to a topological space that is not connected, the definition `IsIso (....counit.app...)` is not the right definition of `IsConstant`.) Changing the definition should not be a problem for your applications to condensed objects.

This should probably be moved to `Sites.ConstantSheaf` or `Sites.Equivalence`. (I would suspect that there is a more general commutation of `constantSheaf` with `Functor.sheafPullback`, under suitable assumptions, but this could be left for a separate PR.)

```suggestion
A sheaf is constant if it is in the essential image of the constant sheaf functor.
```
In the statement, it would be better to use `letI`, or replace e by `sheafEquiv ...`.

I only used `let e := ...` because the name of `sheafEquiv` used to be so long :-) 
I'll change it to `sheafEquiv`Â in the statement.
This looks like a loop. I would suggest keeping as an instance only the version `... [IsConstant J F] ... : IsIso ...`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(CategoryTheory/Sites): remove unused lemmas and simplify some proofs in Sites.Discrete

source.title: chore(CategoryTheory/Sites): remove unused lemmas and simplify some proofs in Sites.Discrete
